snippet: Three men who parachuted from the 1,776-foot tower showed a “callous disregard” for the community’s safety, a State Supreme Court judge said.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Charles H Solomon declines to throw out felony charges against James Brady, Marko Markovich and Andrew Rossig, sky divers who parachuted off 1 World Trade Center; ruling brings men a step closer to trial; sky divers and their lookout Kyle Hartwell say they are guilty only of trespassing, not reckless endangerment and felony burglary.
lead_paragraph: Three men who parachuted from the 1,776-foot tower showed a “callous disregard” for the community’s safety, a State Supreme Court judge said.

headline.main: Judge Declines to Drop Felony Charges in 1 World Trade Center Jump
headline.print_headline: Judge Declines to Drop Felony Charges in Trade Center Jump
